Description: Kâravânsérây, one of two studies for Plate 27 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; figures and animals resting before a caravanserai or inn with steps and colonnade Pen and grey ink, with grey and brown wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Victor Pillement. Only two of the three drawings for this plate are in the Museum. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
